video.title: Life on Location
video.synopsis: Members of the BBC's "Life" production crew go behind the scenes to explain just what it took to capture key sequences of the program.

episodes.synopsis: This behind-the-scenes look at the making of the show includes the filming of Antarctic killer whales, which have never been filmed hunting.
episodes.title: Ice Alliance

episodes.synopsis: The Komodo film crew tell of the harrowing experience of filming the dragon hunt.
episodes.title: Chasing the Dragon

episodes.synopsis: The team attempt to film the humpback whale's mating contest; this requires local knowledge, hours on the water and a big slice of luck.
episodes.title: The Heat Run

episodes.synopsis: A closer look at the making of Life, including how the cameramen filmed underwater while trying to avoid getting caught up in the action.
episodes.title: Fish Out of Water

episodes.synopsis: The end result of a long and difficult quest, mating between Vogelkop bowerbirds is filmed for the first time.
episodes.title: Hide and Seek

episodes.synopsis: A behind the scenes look at how the Life programme makers tried to capture the activities of monarch butterflies by flying a camera amongst them.
episodes.title: Flying with Butterflies

episodes.synopsis: Two members of the Life crew get up close and personal with elephant seals; although getting too close could jeopardize the integrity of the film.
episodes.title: Rock Pooling

episodes.synopsis: Explores the life of marine invertebrates, the earliest life forms on earth from a billion years ago.
episodes.title: Sink or Swim

episodes.synopsis: An in-depth look at how the film makers employed various techniques in order to capture plants at their best.
episodes.title: Time Warp

episodes.synopsis: The crew found they shared a great affinity with chimpanzees when they filmed them in their natural habitat.
episodes.title: Ninety Nine Percent
